tasks.label: (build): Build the project using the build script defined in `package.json`
(clean): Removes optional folders that are cached during various tasks
(commit): Lint staged files, report spelling errors, and open a _required_ commit dialoge
(fix): Run code auto-fixers / auto-formatters
(init): Runs the initialization script
(jumpusb): Creates a JumpUSB (https://jumpusb.com)
(lint): Lints the project using all linters
(livereload): Start the project with live-reloading (i.e. watch mode)
(preload): Set up your workstation in advance by installing commonly used programs
(prepare): Prepares the project for the normal start command
(publish): Publish a semantic release via `semantic-release`
(reset): Resets the project by removing all caches and then re-generating templated files
(scripts): Run and view descriptions for `npm scripts` via an interactive dialog
(services): Update elements of the repository that require API access
(shell): Start a terminal session using Docker with any Linux operating system
(start): Start the project by installing / updating dependencies, repairing issues, and opening a tutorial
(synchronize): Set up the project and refresh it with the latest changes
(test): Open an interactive dialog to select and run a Molecule test
(update): Fully update the repository
(yubikey): Create an OpenGPG-enabled YubiKey
(ansible:playbook:environment): Prompts for which environment to use and then symlinks to it
(ansible:playbook:find-missing:files): Find roles that are missing files
(ansible:populate:dependencies): Attempt to automatically populate `meta/main.yml` and `requirements.yml`
(ansible:test:local): Run the Ansible play on the local machine (or via WSL - see task summary)
(ansible:test:molecule:docker): Runs a Docker Molecule test
(ansible:test:molecule:local): Runs a Molecule test on the localhost
(ansible:test:molecule:ssh): Runs a Molecule test over SSH
(ansible:test:molecule:virtualbox): Runs a full E2E Molecule test for all supported operating systems
(ansible:test:molecule:virtualbox:converge): Provisions a desktop VirtualBox VM and then runs a Molecule test
(ansible:test:vagrant): Runs the playbook using Vagrant
(ci:github:actions:test): Locally test the on-push GitHub Action event (only works for Linux containers)
(commit:all): Add all the untracked changes and commit the code
(common:code:count): Display a chart detailing the lines of code for each language used
(common:code:find:todo): Scan code base for TODOs and FIXMEs
(docker:build): Build a regular Docker image and then generate a slim build from it
(docker:build:fat:build): Build a normal Docker container from the Dockerfile
(docker:build:slim): Build a slim version of the Docker image
(docker:publish): Publish the Docker images (using `Docker*.test.yml` files)
(docker:shell): Open the terminal of an existing Docker image
(docker:test): Perform all available tests on the Docker image
(docker:test:container-structure-test): Runs ContainerStructureTest for Dockerfile build
(docker:test:output): For each folder matching `./test/output*`, ensure slim and latest output match with default command
(fix:eslint): Fix ESLint errors automatically
(fix:eslint:staged): Auto-fix only modified files with ESLint
(fix:go): Fix Go with all available Go fixers
(fix:json): Format and sort JSON
(fix:markdown): Auto-fixes markdown files
(fix:packer): Automatically fix and format Packer templates
(fix:php): Fix PHP with all available PHP auto-fixers
(fix:prettier): Automatically format most files using Prettier
(fix:python): Automatically format Python files using Black
(fix:shellcheck): Automatically apply fixes to `.sh` and `.sh.j2` files using Shellcheck
(fix:spelling:markdown): Auto-fix spelling errors in markdown files using `misspell`
(fix:toml): Format `.toml` files by alphabetizing and flattening
(fix:yaml): Auto-format and sort YML files
(get:links): Log useful links such as the current project's git repository link
(git:filter): Remove large unnecessary and large files from the repository
(git:remotes): Configure the the `origin`, `gitlab`, `github`, and `all` git remotes
(git:remove:submodules): Remove all submodules in the current directory and optionally filter by RegEx
(go:test:convey): Run tests through the browser with GoConvey
(group:exec): Execute group commands on any GitLab group (including repositories in sub-groups)
(image:compress): Compress JPG/PNG images via TinyPNG
(image:resize): Resize an image
(install:ansible:role): Install an Ansible role by using Docker
(lint:ansible): Lint Ansible projects using Ansible Lint
(lint:any): Generic linting of files for things like destroyed-symlinks, merge conflicts, etc.
(lint:codeclimate): Run CodeClimate with all available linters
(lint:docker): Lint Dockerfiles using Hadolint (requires Docker)
(lint:dockerfilelint): Lint a Dockerfile with `dockerfilelint`
(lint:eslint): Lint with ESLint
(lint:eslint:staged): Lint only modified files with ESLint
(lint:eslint:warn-all): Convert ESLint errors into warnings by saving the modified configuration inside `package.json`
(lint:go): Lint Go with `golangci-lint`
(lint:markdown:markdown): Lint markdown files with `remark`
(lint:markdown:markdown:links): Scan markdown files for broken links
(lint:packer): Validate the Packer templates ending with `template.json`
(lint:php): Lint PHP with all available PHP linters
(lint:prettier): Lint formatting using Prettier
(lint:prose:prose): Lint text/markdown for English prose with `proselint`
(lint:python): Lint Python files using Flake8
(lint:shellcheck): Report possible errors in shell scripts
(lint:spelling): Checks for spelling errors in staged files
(lint:spelling:markdown): Run `misspell` (a spell-checker) on all markdown files
(lint:vagrant): Validate the Vagrantfile
(lint:yaml): Lint `.yml` files using YAML Lint
(nest:benchmark): Initiate a web server benchmarking session (with `clinic`)
(new:project): Create a new project
(npm:build): Build the application
(npm:clean): Remove temporary folders that might conflicts with builds
(npm:cov:open): View the code coverage report in the browser
(npm:cov:upload): Upload code coverage report to `codecov.io`
(npm:depcheck:dependencies): Remove unused dependencies
(npm:doc:html): Generate TypeDoc HTML documentation
(npm:doc:json): Generate TypeDoc JSON documentation
(npm:start): Run the application
(npm:start:inspect): Run the application in `watch` mode and open DevTools
(npm:start:prod): Run the application in `production` mode
(npm:start:prod:inspect): Run the application in `production` and `watch` mode and open DevTools
(npm:test): Run the unit tests for an NPM project
(npm:test:coverage): Generate code coverage assets
(npm:test:dashboard): Run and manage test cases from a web interface (powered by `majestic`)
(npm:test:debug): Debug tests in `watch` mode
(npm:test:inspect): Debug tests with DevTools in `watch` mode
(npm:typesync): Install missing type definitions
(packer:build): Build Packer images for all available platforms
(packer:build:kvm): Build a Packer image for KVM
(packer:build:parallels): Build a Packer image for Parallels
(packer:build:virtualbox): Build a Packer image for VirtualBox
(packer:build:vmware): Build a Packer image for VMWare
(packer:install:platforms): Install all available virtualization providers
(publish:android:beta): Publishes Android app to Firebase beta channel
(publish:android:release): Publishes Android app to Google Play
(publish:app:beta): Publish a beta release of all the release targets
(publish:app:release): Publish a production release of all the targets
(publish:brew:cask): Publishes a Homebrew Cask
(publish:brew:formula): Publishes a Homebrew Formulae
(publish:chrome:release): Publishes Chrome extension
(publish:force): Force a `semantic-release` even if there are no new eligible commits
(publish:ios:beta): Publishes iOS app to Firebase beta channel
(publish:ios:release): Publishes iOS app to iTunes
(publish:opera:release): Publishes Opera extension
(pull:upstream): Pull from upstream repositories
(python:build): Build the project
(python:build:binary): Build standalone binary
(python:publish): Publish the project to PyPi.org
(python:requirementstxt): Generate the requirements.txt fallback file
(python:run): Runs the project by calling `run.py`
(python:test): Runs tests with `pytest` after fixing and linting
(reset:force): Aggressively reset the project (**WARNING** This will wipe uncommitted work)
(security:bandit): Check for Python code security issues
(security:dockle): Analyze and lint the Docker container using Dockle
(security:gitleaks): Scans repository (including git history) for possible leaked keys
(security:grype): Scan container images and file systems for security issues using Grype
(security:private-keys): Scan for private keys
(security:snyk): Analyze the Docker container for security vulnerabilities with Snyk (requires login)
(security:trivy): Analyze the Docker container for security vulnerabilities with Trivy
(security:yubikey:prepare): Prepares an environment by provisioning all the required software / preliminary steps
(symlink:playbook): Symlink all the roles in the roles/ folder to ~/.ansible/roles
(symlink:role): Symlink the current role to ~/.ansible/roles/.
(tag:deps): Inject a new command in the `Taskfile.yml` that includes all tasks matching a given tag as deps
(vagrant:up): Select which virtualization platform to run the image on using an interactive prompt
